course_overview.description: This course is designed for individuals with a foundational understanding of data science who seek to deepen their knowledge and skills. We will explore advanced techniques in data analysis, machine learning, and data visualization to tackle complex data problems and make data-driven decisions.
course_overview.objectives: By the end of the course, participants will be equipped with practical skills to enhance their data science projects and contribute meaningfully to their field.

subtopics.title: Advanced Data Manipulation
learning_objectives: Data Wrangling: Learn advanced techniques for cleaning and preparing data, including handling missing values, outliers, and inconsistencies. Develop the ability to transform raw data into a structured format suitable for analysis.

Feature Engineering: Gain skills in creating new features from existing data to improve the performance of machine learning models. Understand techniques like binning, polynomial features, and interaction terms.

Data Transformation: Explore methods for transforming data, such as normalization, scaling, and encoding categorical variables. Learn how to apply these transformations effectively to prepare data for modeling.
Pandas and Numpy: Deepen your understanding of pandas and numpy libraries for efficient data manipulation. Learn to perform complex operations and manage large datasets.

materials.reading: Python for Data Analysis by Wes McKinney

subtopics.title: Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)
learning_objectives: Statistical Summaries: Learn to generate and interpret statistical summaries of datasets, including measures of central tendency, dispersion, and correlation.
Visualizations: Master advanced visualization techniques such as pair plots, heatmaps, and interactive charts. Understand how to choose appropriate visualizations to uncover insights and patterns.
Hypothesis Testing: Understand the principles of hypothesis testing and how to apply tests like t-tests, chi-square tests, and ANOVA to analyze data.
EDA Tools: Get hands-on experience with tools and libraries for EDA, including seaborn, matplotlib, and plotly.

materials.reading: Data Science from Scratch by Joel Grus

subtopics.title: Advanced Machine Learning
learning_objectives: Model Selection: Learn about various model selection techniques, including cross-validation, grid search, and hyperparameter tuning. Understand how to choose the best model for your data.
Ensemble Methods: Explore ensemble methods such as bagging, boosting, and stacking. Learn how these methods can improve model performance and robustness.
Feature Selection: Understand techniques for feature selection, including recursive feature elimination, LASSO, and tree-based methods. Learn how to identify and retain the most important features.

Model Evaluation: Gain insights into advanced model evaluation metrics such as ROC curves, precision-recall curves, and confusion matrices. Learn how to interpret these metrics to assess model performance.

materials.reading: Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn, Keras, and TensorFlow by Aurélien Géron

subtopics.title: Time Series Analysis
learning_objectives: Time Series Decomposition: Learn to decompose time series data into trend, seasonality, and residual components. Understand how these components affect forecasting.
Forecasting Models: Explore advanced forecasting models such as ARIMA, SARIMA, and Prophet. Learn how to apply these models to predict future values.
Seasonal and Trend Analysis: Understand how to identify and model seasonal and trend components in time series data. Learn techniques for improving forecast accuracy.
Stationarity Testing: Gain skills in testing for stationarity and transforming non-stationary time series data to make it suitable for modeling.

materials.video: Time Series Forecasting with ARIMA and Prophet
materials.reading: Practical Time Series Analysis by Aileen Nielsen

subtopics.title: Data Ethics and Privacy
learning_objectives: Ethical Considerations: Understand the ethical implications of data science, including issues related to bias, fairness, and transparency. Learn how to incorporate ethical practices into your data science workflow.
Data Privacy: Explore data privacy regulations and best practices for protecting sensitive information. Understand concepts like data anonymization and encryption.
Ethical AI: Learn about the ethical challenges associated with artificial intelligence and machine learning. Understand how to develop and deploy AI systems responsibly.
Case Studies: Review case studies of data ethics and privacy issues to learn from real-world examples and apply best practices.

materials.reading: Weapons of Math Destruction by Cathy O'Neil

course_conclusion.summary: Congratulations on completing the Intermediate Data Science course! You have developed a deeper understanding of advanced data manipulation, exploratory data analysis, machine learning techniques, time series analysis, and data ethics.
course_conclusion.next_steps: To continue your learning journey, consider exploring specialized topics such as deep learning, natural language processing, or big data technologies. Engaging in hands-on projects and contributing to open-source initiatives can further enhance your expertise.
